content:
• Thursday, January 12, 2012
  • SYUT

    Synutra International (NASDAQ:SYUT) releases a statement regarding earlier reports that a pair...

    Synutra International (NASDAQ:SYUT) releases a statement regarding earlier reports that a pair of 4-month old twins in Jiangxi province became ill with severe intestinal symptoms. The company claims the incident was unrelated to the company's products. It further noted it's not planning to conduct a product recall, saying it's confident the product's safety. Shares -1.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:57 PM
  • ROVI

    Rovi (NASDAQ:ROVI) jumps 3.8% AH after disclosing ahead of its investor day meeting (webcast)...

    Rovi (NASDAQ:ROVI) jumps 3.8% AH after disclosing ahead of its investor day meeting (webcast) it's establishing 2012 revenue guidance of $810M-$840M ($829.5M consensus) and EPS guidance of $2.50-$2.80 ($2.64 consensus). In addition, Rovi is announcing the sale of its Roxio PC media software business to Corel for an undisclosed sum. (earlier)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:57 PM
  • PG

    "Procter & Gamble (NYSE:PG) has an aversion to the DOJ," tweets Jim Cramer, summing up...

    "Procter & Gamble (NYSE:PG) has an aversion to the DOJ," tweets Jim Cramer, summing up why a criminal investigation of Diamond Foods (NASDAQ:DMND) could mean the end of its sale of Pringles to P&G. Shares of Diamond -11.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:00 PM
  • YTEN

    Metabolix (MBLX) resumes trading, down nearly 50% following news that ADM terminated its JV with...

    Metabolix (MBLX) resumes trading, down nearly 50% following news that ADM terminated its JV with the company to sell bioplastics after undertaking a strategic review. MBLX -49.1% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM
  • DMND

    The DOJ is investigating possible criminal fraud associated with accounting practices at Diamond...

    The DOJ is investigating possible criminal fraud associated with accounting practices at Diamond Foods (NASDAQ:DMND), according to sources. At issue is how the company accounted for payments to walnut growers last year. The SEC and the company's board already have an ongoing investigation. Shares -12% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM | 3 Comments
  • EXPE

    Expedia (EXPE -1.5%) sold off a bit today after it was reported President Scott Durschlag had...

    Expedia (EXPE -1.5%) sold off a bit today after it was reported President Scott Durschlag had resigned. A company spokesperson didn't provide a reason as to why Durschlag, who was previously COO of Skype, quit, but said his role would now be handled by CEO Dara Khosrowshahi.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • JDAS

    JDA Software (NASDAQ:JDAS) reports preliminary revenue of about $173M for Q4, and $670M for...

    JDA Software (NASDAQ:JDAS) reports preliminary revenue of about $173M for Q4, and $670M for FY11, below analyst forecasts of $181M and $678M respectively. Shares -10% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • ADM

    Archer Daniels Midland (NYSE:ADM) terminates a JV with Metabolix (MBLX) to sell bioplastics...

    Archer Daniels Midland (NYSE:ADM) terminates a JV with Metabolix (MBLX) to sell bioplastics after undertaking a strategic review. Shares of ADM -0.4% AH, trading in MBLX halted until 4:35 PM EST.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM
  • SFLY

    Shutterfly (NASDAQ:SFLY) -4.9% AH as it says CFO Mark Rubash has left the company to join an...

    Shutterfly (NASDAQ:SFLY) -4.9% AH as it says CFO Mark Rubash has left the company to join an early-stage medical tech company.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • ATW

    Atwood Oceanics (ATW -1.7%) sees a bit of selling pressure after announcing it sold $450M worth...

    Atwood Oceanics (ATW -1.7%) sees a bit of selling pressure after announcing it sold $450M worth of 6.5% notes due in 2020. The offshore driller intends to use the proceeds to reduce borrowings made under an existing credit facility.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • OCZ

    OCZ Technology (OCZ +5.5%) gets a boost from an IHS report saying cache solid-state drive...

    OCZ Technology (OCZ +5.5%) gets a boost from an IHS report saying cache solid-state drive (SSD) shipments will rise 100X through 2015, thanks to Intel's (NASDAQ:INTC) Ultrabook project.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM
  • URBN

    Wedbush upgrades Urban Outfitters (URBN +2.7%), countering Citi's negative view after...

    Wedbush upgrades Urban Outfitters (URBN +2.7%), countering Citi's negative view after yesterday's selloff prompted by the departure of its CEO. The return of the co-founder as CEO "may provide a positive catalyst" that will "accelerate the much anticipated turnaround," where Wedbush sees signs of improvement after URBN's struggles with fashion mishaps and high inventory. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM | 1 Comment

  • There's carnage in the grain pits after today's final USDA report on the 2011 harvest shows...

    There's carnage in the grain pits after today's final USDA report on the 2011 harvest shows greater-than-expected production and ending stocks, surprising traders who had been leaning the other way. Corn was locked limit down all day, -6.1% at $6.11/bushel. Wheat -6.2% at $6.01. Beans -1.6% at $11.83. (ag stocks)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM | 6 Comments
  • HCBK

    Hudson City Bancorp's (HCBK -2.8%) re-mortgaging issues have slowed but not ended, Nomura says,...

    Hudson City Bancorp's (HCBK -2.8%) re-mortgaging issues have slowed but not ended, Nomura says, cutting shares to Reduce from Neutral, noting its asset mix and existing mortgage yields "will eventually fall" given newer market rates. "While every bank has this issue, it is more acute for HCBK as 99% of revenue comes from net interest income," Nomura says, vs. 65% for the average bank.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • PAG

    Penske Automotive (PAG +1.9%) expands its U.K. presence with the acquisition a number of...

    Penske Automotive (PAG +1.9%) expands its U.K. presence with the acquisition a number of dealerships in Belfast from the Isaac Agnew Group. Terms were not disclosed, but the company says the dealerships are expected to contribute approximately $500M in annualized revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM
  • URBN

    Urban Outfitters (NASDAQ:URBN) CFO Eric Artz spins some damage control at the ICR XChange...

    Urban Outfitters (NASDAQ:URBN) CFO Eric Artz spins some damage control at the ICR XChange conference in Miami - telling his audience that future CEO Richard Hayne has been an active participant in the firm's strategy and "knows what's going on." What's going on for URBN investors is a modest 2.5% gain after seeing shares fall off 18.6% yesterday.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM
  • FTNT

    Fortinet (FTNT +2.6%) moves up after being initiated with an Outperform at FBN Securities. The...

    Fortinet (FTNT +2.6%) moves up after being initiated with an Outperform at FBN Securities. The firm says Fortinet is the largest and most dominant player in the unified threat management space, and continues to gain market share. Additionally, channel checks show revenue growth could exceed 25% in 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM +3.8%) is posting a nice gain on account of rumors it has hired Goldman...

    Research In Motion (RIMM +3.8%) is posting a nice gain on account of rumors it has hired Goldman Sachs to "explore strategic options." Jaguar Financial and other activist investors have been pushing for RIM, which now trades below book value, to explore a sale. Moreover, it was reported last month that Amazon, Nokia, and Microsoft have kicked the tires.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM
  • XEL

    Xcel Energy (XEL -1.3%) says 2012 earnings will come in at the low end of EPS guidance, now...

    Xcel Energy (XEL -1.3%) says 2012 earnings will come in at the low end of EPS guidance, now expecting to report between $1.75 - $1.85. The company attributes the weak results to sluggish electric and natural gas demand, and plans to implement cost reductions to offset the impact.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM
  • BWEN

    Broadwind Energy (BWEN +12.9%) says orders were strong in Q4, including a $23M order for wind...

    Broadwind Energy (BWEN +12.9%) says orders were strong in Q4, including a $23M order for wind turbine towers - its first from a leading U.S. wind turbine manufacturer.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:34 PM
  • AUY

    Canadian miner Yamana Gold (AUY +4.5%) rallies after saying it produced 1.1M gold equivalent...

    Canadian miner Yamana Gold (AUY +4.5%) rallies after saying it produced 1.1M gold equivalent ounces in 2011, up 5% Y/Y. Cash costs were also less than projected, and it's targeting a 13% increase in FY12 production versus last year.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • FOSL

    Brean Murray analyst Eric Beder says the big turn north in shares of Fossil (FOSL +5.5%) stems...

    Brean Murray analyst Eric Beder says the big turn north in shares of Fossil (FOSL +5.5%) stems from a positive presentation at the ICR Xchange conference in Miami. On the scene, he calls the firm's showing one of the few upbeat ones at the meeting of retailers and says his firm remains an aggressive buyer of the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM
  • INFY

    The weak FQ4 guidance attached to Infosys' (INFY -10%) FQ3 report is affecting shares of rival...

    The weak FQ4 guidance attached to Infosys' (INFY -10%) FQ3 report is affecting shares of rival Wipro (WIT -4.1%), and perhaps also those of IT services kingpin IBM (IBM -1.7%). During its earnings call, Infosys expressed optimism about a turbulent macro environment increasing corporate interest in offshore services, but also suggested IT budgets "could be flat or slightly down" this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • SITC

    DDR (DDR +3%) prices its 16.5M share offering at $12.95, a 0.9% discount from Wednesday's...

    DDR (DDR +3%) prices its 16.5M share offering at $12.95, a 0.9% discount from Wednesday's closing price. The shares - which are part of a finance arrangement with its JV partner Blackstone - are being offered in connection with a forward sale agreement with Goldman Sachs and Citigroup, in which each are expected to borrow and sell half the shares offered.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • NUVA

    NuVasive (NUVA -3.2%) gives back a little today, despite being upgraded to Above Average at...

    NuVasive (NUVA -3.2%) gives back a little today, despite being upgraded to Above Average at Caris. The stock has ramped nearly 15% higher over the past two days, following an earlier upgrade by ThinkEquity and an upbeat preliminary FY11 earnings report.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM
  • COG

    Cabot Oil & Gas (COG -1.6%) CEO Dan Dinges' response to "continued misinformation...

    Cabot Oil & Gas (COG -1.6%) CEO Dan Dinges' response to "continued misinformation around our pricing" hasn't stopped the bleeding in shares of the natural gas producer a day after sustaining an 11% drop. Commodity prices are “not where we want them,” Dinges says, but they "still afford our Marcellus project a significant rate of return around 55%-60% before hedges."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • ONE

    Higher One Holdings (ONE -3.4%) trades lower after saying its CEO Dean Hatton plans to retire in...

    Higher One Holdings (ONE -3.4%) trades lower after saying its CEO Dean Hatton plans to retire in June, naming co-founder and CFO Mark Volchek as his replacement.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • MANT

    ManTech International (MANT +4.9%) pops after saying it was awarded a $507M contract...

    ManTech International (MANT +4.9%) pops after saying it was awarded a $507M contract modification by the U.S. Army to continue providing logistics and support for the military's mine-resistant vehicles.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM
  • SINA

    Sina (SINA +5%) shares are upgraded to Overweight at J.P. Morgan, which contends a selloff...

    Sina (SINA +5%) shares are upgraded to Overweight at J.P. Morgan, which contends a selloff prompted by China's new rules requiring users of its Twitter-like Weibo platform to register with their real names is overdone. Weibo had 250M users in November, up from 200M in August, and Sina has started to target ways to monetize the site, the analysis says.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM | 1 Comment
  • GEOS

    OYO Geospace (OYOG +3.4%) trades higher after announcing a $14.7M order from TGC Industries,...

    OYO Geospace (OYOG +3.4%) trades higher after announcing a $14.7M order from TGC Industries, which will purchase 14.2K units of an OYO product that enables the wireless acquisition of seismic data for oil and gas reservoirs.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM
  • CAE

    Canadian aviation trainer CAE (CAE +4%) moves higher after saying it's sold five full-flight...

    Canadian aviation trainer CAE (CAE +4%) moves higher after saying it's sold five full-flight simulators to customers in Asia, netting approximately C$65M on the deals.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:07 PM
  • CCI

    Crown Castle International (CCI -1.4%) agrees to buy a portfolio of ground lease-related assets...

    Crown Castle International (CCI -1.4%) agrees to buy a portfolio of ground lease-related assets from privately held Wireless Capital Partners for about $180M in cash and the assumption of $320M in debt. The purchase gives the cell-tower company greater control over some of its towers.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • LAZ

    Lazard (LAZ -1.4%) shares slip after Citigroup lowers its rating to Neutral and trims the asset...

    Lazard (LAZ -1.4%) shares slip after Citigroup lowers its rating to Neutral and trims the asset manager's 2012 earnings outlook by 11%. But some other alternative asset managers, including Blackstone (BX -1.7%), also are negative, possibly a by-product of the political flare-up over Mitt Romney's time at Bain Capital and whether PE firms are "vulture capitalists."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • FOSL

    Shares of Fossil (FOSL +6.1%) see a big midday spike that trader chatter is trying to pin on a...

    Shares of Fossil (FOSL +6.1%) see a big midday spike that trader chatter is trying to pin on a painful short squeeze. The consumer fashion designer snapped up Skagen earlier this week in a deal that is seen as a "good fit" by analysts.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • WPP-OLD

    Wausau Paper (WPP-OLD +1.7%) trades up after activist hedge fund Starboard Value sent a letter...

    Wausau Paper (WPP-OLD +1.7%) trades up after activist hedge fund Starboard Value sent a letter to the company, urging it to expand its strategic review to include a potential sale of its paper segment or the entire company.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM
  • MFLX

    UBS analyst Maynard Um thinks Multi-Fineline's (MFLX +18.6%) FQ1 pre-announcement may bode well...

    UBS analyst Maynard Um thinks Multi-Fineline's (MFLX +18.6%) FQ1 pre-announcement may bode well for Apple (AAPL -0.5%): "MFLX saw weakness... partly from a later iPhone 4S launch, so strong results and a better than seasonal outlook for next quarter may indicate underlying demand strength for iPhone/iPad.” Apple is believed to have accounted for 66% of MFLX's FQ1 sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM | 2 Comments
  • TIVO

    TiVo (TIVO +1.7%) CEO Tom Rogers enthusiastically tells Bloomberg TV (video) that the firm has...

    TiVo (TIVO +1.7%) CEO Tom Rogers enthusiastically tells Bloomberg TV (video) that the firm has shifted from "on demand" model to a "get whatever you want, whenever you want" model. He also remains confident the firm will be "extremely" profitable this year, helped in part by resolutions from ongoing legal disputes with Microsoft, Motorola Mobility, and Verizon over IP claims.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • GEOY

    GeoEye (GEOY -6.7%) takes a hit after Benchmark cut the shares to Hold, over concern the company...

    GeoEye (GEOY -6.7%) takes a hit after Benchmark cut the shares to Hold, over concern the company could lower guidance due to funding cuts at the National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM
  • ECA

    EnCana (ECA -2.1%) dips after BofA Merrill Lynch cut the shares to Underperform from Neutral...

    EnCana (ECA -2.1%) dips after BofA Merrill Lynch cut the shares to Underperform from Neutral this morning, citing weak natural gas pricing.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • ZIOP

    Shares of Ziopharm (ZIOP -5.4%) trail off after the firm underwhelms investors with its...

    Shares of Ziopharm (ZIOP -5.4%) trail off after the firm underwhelms investors with its presentation at the JPMorgan Healthcare Conference.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • SYUT

    Synutra (NASDAQ:SYUT), a Chinese provider of infant formula, drops 13.1% after local regulators...

    Synutra (NASDAQ:SYUT), a Chinese provider of infant formula, drops 13.1% after local regulators open up an investigation of the company, following the death of a baby who had consumed Synutra's milk formula. The company, which has drawn the scrutiny of health regulators in the past, has issued a statement defending the safety of its products.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • WWW

    Wolverine Worldwide (WWW -3.9%) CFO Don Grimes says the company's full-year profit forecast will...

    Wolverine Worldwide (WWW -3.9%) CFO Don Grimes says the company's full-year profit forecast will come in at the low end of its prior $2.46-$2.52 EPS range, with Q4 results hurt partly by a "conservative appetite" by U.S. retailers and "softening retail impact" in both Europe and the U.S. (form 8-K)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM
  • SAFM

    Shares of Sanderson Farms (SAFM +6.4%) and Pilgrim's Pride (PPC +5.3%) show strength after the...

    Shares of Sanderson Farms (SAFM +6.4%) and Pilgrim's Pride (PPC +5.3%) show strength after the USDA raises its estimate (.pdf) for 2011 corn crop production. Corn futures +1% to $657.50/bushel.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM
  • NTR

    Agriculture stocks open lower following the USDA's supply/demand report, which is slightly...

    Agriculture stocks open lower following the USDA's supply/demand report, which is slightly negative for grain prices due to an expected increase in global wheat and corn inventory levels. Fertilizer stocks: POT -4%, CF -3.9%, MOS -3.7%, IPI -3%, AGU -1.7%, RNF -1.2%. Seed names: MON -0.3%, SYT +0.3%. Farm equipment:AGCO -3.2%, TITN -1.7%, DE -1.5%, CNH -1.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM
  • MNK

    Oppenheimer comes to the defense of Questcor (QCOR -1.5%), which was crushed yesterday after...

    Oppenheimer comes to the defense of Questcor (QCOR -1.5%), which was crushed yesterday after arriving on TheStreetSweeper's crosshairs. In reiterating an Outperform, Oppenheimer says there is no evidence Questcor promotes its Acthar drug for off-label uses. However, the market continues to have its concerns; shares are selling off again today, giving back yesterday's AH gains in the process.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM
  • CA

    Activist investment firm Taconic Capital discloses a 5.1% stake in CA (CA +4.5%) and urges the...

    Activist investment firm Taconic Capital discloses a 5.1% stake in CA (CA +4.5%) and urges the company to take steps to improve shareholder returns, including returning more cash to shareholders and boosting profit margins in its enterprise solutions business segment “to appropriate levels."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM

  • The euro has risen sharply throughout Mario Draghi's press conference (now over) as he gives no...

    The euro has risen sharply throughout Mario Draghi's press conference (now over) as he gives no indication the ECB may ease beyond what it has already done. In fact, he says the bank is seeing signs of "stabilization" in the EU economy. Euro +0.8% at $1.2802.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:35 AM
  • LOCM

    Online media company Local.com (NASDAQ:LOCM) +5.7% premarket after announcing record Q4 search...

    Online media company Local.com (NASDAQ:LOCM) +5.7% premarket after announcing record Q4 search traffic of 93.7M monthly unique visitors, up from 91.9M in Q3 and 80.1M in the year-ago period. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • PVH

    Warnaco (WRC) -6.9% premarket after CEO Helen McCluskey says Q4 results are expected to come in...

    Warnaco (WRC) -6.9% premarket after CEO Helen McCluskey says Q4 results are expected to come in "a few pennies below" earlier estimates, due to factors including shortfalls in Europe and unfavorable currency rates. She says same-store sales improved throughout the quarter, with December same-store sales up 5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 AM

  • Market preview: U.S. futures and EU stocks are mainly up but are off earlier highs in the wake...

    Market preview: U.S. futures and EU stocks are mainly up but are off earlier highs in the wake of worse-than-expected jobless claims and retail sales. S&P futures +0.2%. Sentiment had been boosted by strong Spanish and Italian bond sales. Sears -7.3% after it loses a source of ready cash flow, while Chevron is -2.8% following its profit warning. Later: Business Inventories, EIA Natural Gas Inventory
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • DKS

    Dick's Sporting Goods (NYSE:DKS) +9.3% premarket after announcing a $200M buyback of its common...

    Dick's Sporting Goods (NYSE:DKS) +9.3% premarket after announcing a $200M buyback of its common stock from cash on hand over the next 12 months. Dick's also lowers the high-end of Q4 and FY2011 EPS guidance by a penny, now expecting Q4 profit of $0.87-$0.88 and full-year $2.01 to $2.02, blaming warm winter weather.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM
  • WSM

    Investors look past the positive PR, sending Williams Sonoma (WSM -11.6%) sharply lower...

    Investors look past the positive PR, sending Williams Sonoma (WSM -11.6%) sharply lower premarket on reduced Q4 guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:01 AM
  • DKS

    Premarket gainers: DKS +9%. JASO +8%. SINA +5%. ING +5%. QCOR +5%. OPWV +5%. HL +3%. RENN +3%....

    Premarket gainers: DKS +9%. JASO +8%. SINA +5%. ING +5%. QCOR +5%. OPWV +5%. HL +3%. RENN +3%. DB +3%.
    Losers: WSM -12%. PMC -10%. INFY -10%. SHLD -8%. OCR -4%. WYNN -4%. STP -4%. EK -4%. TSL -3%. CPT -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • SOHU

    Though JPMorgan slashes its price target on Sohu.com (NASDAQ:SOHU) to $68 from $91, shares...

    Though JPMorgan slashes its price target on Sohu.com (NASDAQ:SOHU) to $68 from $91, shares remain pesky and trade 2.2% higher premarket. Helping the cause, the new PT set by JPM still reps 28% upside potential and analysts kept an Overweight rating in place on the Chinese Internet concern.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 AM

  • Stock index futures give up most of their early gains in the wake of the worse-than-expected...

    Stock index futures give up most of their early gains in the wake of the worse-than-expected jobless claims and retail sales prints. S&P 500 +0.2% after being up about 0.8% before the numbers.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:40 AM
  • SJR

    Shaw Communications (NYSE:SJR): FQ1 EPS of $0.48 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $1.28B (+18.5% Y/Y)...

    Shaw Communications (NYSE:SJR): FQ1 EPS of $0.48 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $1.28B (+18.5% Y/Y) misses by $10M. Shares +1.9% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:35 AM
  • INFY

    Infosys (NASDAQ:INFY) -9.5% premarket after the Indian software exporter forecasts ~$7.03B in...

    Infosys (NASDAQ:INFY) -9.5% premarket after the Indian software exporter forecasts ~$7.03B in sales for the year period ending March 31; in October, it had estimated sales of $7.08B-$$7.2B. Quarterly profit topped expectations, with FQ3 earnings of 23.7B rupees ($458M) up 15.4% Y/Y.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:32 AM
  • UNCFF

    Unicredit +12.7% is leading Italy higher (+3.3%) as a local paper reports Kazakhstan's Samruk...

    Unicredit +12.7% is leading Italy higher (+3.3%) as a local paper reports Kazakhstan's Samruk Kazyna Fund has taken a stake in the lender. Earlier, Blackrock retracted a statement it had slashed its stake in the bank. The shares remain lower by about 50% since the Jan. 4 capital raise.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:19 AM
  • TGT

    Target (NYSE:TGT) authorizes a new $5B share buyback program, and declares a quarterly dividend...

    Target (NYSE:TGT) authorizes a new $5B share buyback program, and declares a quarterly dividend of $0.30/share. Shares +1.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:18 AM
  • CACH

    Cache (OTC:CACH) revises its Q4 guidance lower, saying it now sees EPS falling in a range of...

    Cache (OTC:CACH) revises its Q4 guidance lower, saying it now sees EPS falling in a range of $0.16-$0.18 vs. $0.24 prior. The specialty retailer forecasts that comparable store sales increased 12% during the quarter. Shares -4.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:18 AM
  • WYNN

    A lawsuit filed by Universal Entertainment's Kazuo Okada seeks to force Wynn Resorts...

    A lawsuit filed by Universal Entertainment's Kazuo Okada seeks to force Wynn Resorts (NASDAQ:WYNN) to open up their books regarding a $129M pledge to a Macau university and delve into details of a stockholder agreement amendment that followed Stephen Wynn's divorce. Okada says he's seeking to protect his $380M stake in Wynn - an investment that is down a sharp 7.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:52 AM
  • ADRNY

    Delhaize (DEG) plans to cut 5K jobs and close more stores in the U.S. and Europe in moves that...

    Delhaize (DEG) plans to cut 5K jobs and close more stores in the U.S. and Europe in moves that it says will shave 2.4% off of revenue this year. The grocery store operator expects to take a €120M ($152M) charge in Q4 related to the store closing on the U.S. side of the pond. Shares off 7.4% in Brussels trading, down 8.6% premarket in U.S.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:17 AM
